bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to G.W. McCoy, February 23, 1925

div1.p: Carter requests books from the Library of Congress.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to G.W. McCoy, February 23, 1925
div1.opener:
Book
Library
Cm
/LC
Hygienic Laboratory
RECEIVED
FEB 24 1925
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
February 23, 1925.
Dear Doctor McCoy:
div1.p:
I would be very grateful to you if you could get me, from the Library
of Congress:
1: La Historia de las Indias
by
Bartolomé de las Casas
Vols. 3 and 4.
2: Historia General y Natural de las Indias
by
Gonzalo Fernandez de Oviedo y Valdés,
Vol. 3.

With best remembrances to you and yours. and always appreciating the
great assistance you are rendering me in procuring the books, I remain
div1.closer:
Sincerely your friend, H. R. Carter Surgeon G. W. McCoy, Director,
Hygienic Laboratory,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C.
The books sent me a few days ago will be ready to go back when
the others come.
23

Page 5 - April
F. June 25
Sat " 26 - landed Insert B. Co.
S 27
28 its left town - D entered
July 4 Tom hunt, Castle blam up
& D., embarked
8-2 hours after sunrise all slept set
Sail along the Coast of Gran Canon
(man, died whose leg had been shot off.)
& came to anchor
9 went ashore to bury. the man & for water
10 aboard again - calm - & could not sail
11 - sailed to gomera, 13 landed in Gomera
5 took how, 14 - D. in hills: 19 burnit G. & went
aboard. 20 lay still in Roads aboard Ship: Gen'l went to the Meys
Indies with his Navy: on Aug 21
Fletcher
